summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 7043, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-fifth Avenue, from East Union to the south line of J. H. Rengstorff's Addition, by grading and parking, in conformity with the following plan: roadway to be thirty-two feet wide, parking strips to be seventeen feet wide along both sides of said roadway, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency", approved March 14, 1899, and ordinance number 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
